title: (x) Armor All Font - probably custom, suggestions {Mike Y}
content:
Can anyone ID this font for me please? Thank you.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [mgrfxarmorall-08small.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100224082431/http:/typophile.com/files/mgrfxarmorall-08small.jpg) | 86.88 KB |
author: abharkl

comments.content:
Probably custom, as most trademarks are. To re-create it you can look for similar sans without the notches, and then add them to reproduce this look.

- Mike Yanega
Thanks Any idea on a good font to base it from then.

I looked for something with squarish counters and an R with the leg coming from near the stem. Came up with [Gnuolane](http://web.archive.org/web/20100224082431/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/gnuolane/) by Ray Larabie.

You would need to flatten the type, or widen it, but I think you could look rather close.

- Mike Yanega
thanks. I will give that one a try. I was using aharoni because of its proximity to what i thought it could be and going from there. Appreciate the response.

Aharoni is a Hebrew font. On my machine, the Latin characters are actually Futura or Twentieth Century.

- Lex
